Tirumala: Darshan process for senior citizens gets easier

According to Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD), two special slots are allotted for senior citizens visiting Tirumala. While the first darshan schedule starts at 10 am, the second schedule starts at 3 pm.

Senior citizens can avail of this benefit by showing proof of their age at the S1 counter. Photo ID proof is mandatory.

TTD has provided several facilities for senior citizens:
- Seating arrangements are available
- The path is prepared so that there are no stairs to climb
- Free food is provided while waiting for darshan
- The darshan ticket is free
- Laddu ticket costs Rs 20 (2 laddus per person)
- Additional laddus can be purchased for Rs 25
- A battery car is available from the car parking area to drop seniors at the counter

During the senior citizens' darshan, the general queue will be temporarily stopped. The entire darshan process takes approximately 30 minutes, depending on the crowd, according to TTD officials.

This initiative aims to make the pilgrimage experience more comfortable and accessible for older visitors to the Tirumala temple.
